resource.chars:
a.a. beds of Sandstone, unaltered
b.b. hardened portion of the Sandstone, deprived of the
minor traces of stratification.
c.c. Sandstone close to the walls of the fissure
vertically laminated
F.F. the fissure filled with calcareous spar & clay.
The changes which have taken place
near the fissure are identical with those described
by Mr. Hunt (49 & 51) the mass of the rock
being laminated on the one part <s>side<\s> & rendered more
solid on the other, which we may safely
conclude to have been produced by galvanic
currents passing between the mass filling
up the fissure & the body of the rock on
each side: but it would be too bold a speculation
which should attempt to explain the regular
cleavage of whole formations of Slate by com-
paring it to the trifling change described above.
